data.title: Awesome Veggie Dinner
data.text: We have eaten at dozens of Thai Restaurants all over North America. Without a doubt, one of the best meals. Every dish was awesome!! Will be making Bangkok Bay a regular eatery!!

data.title: Favorite Thai lunch
data.text: One of my favorite places for a Thai lunch. The lunch special includes a mushroom/coconut milk soup and a small side salad (just lettuce and a few carrot slivers). The portions are not huge, so I don't leave feeling heavy.

data.title: so happy we found this restaurant
data.text: The menu isn't as extensive as some Thai restaurants yet it has absolutely everything I love (which most Thai restaurants don't have).  They have pumpkin curry (kabocha squash), spinach with meat and peanut sauce, pineapple fried rice with lots of pineapple.  I have trouble finding even one of these dishes sometimes and they have them ALL and many more dishes I've never heard of that I'll definitely be back to try (Thai Tango Mango and Drunken Noodles both sound amazing).  Prices are reasonable and for lunch for less than $3 you can add many yummy sides (I added Thai Chicken Satay).

data.title: Delicious food, great service
data.text:
We had lunch at the Bangkok Bay Restaurant while staying in Redwood City and liked it so much that we had dinner there that same day.
The restaurant is nicely decorated, clean and very pleasant.  The service was great and the food, which was healthfully prepared, was really tasty and plentiful.  We will eat there again on our return visit to Stanford Hospital.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text:
Amazing food! Really authentic and when you ask for spicy dish you will get SPICY food! I had Penang Beef Curry! So good! We will definitely be back!  

Atmosphere is good, and staff is efficient. Recommend!

data.title: Dinner after the Christmas holidays...
data.text:
wanting something different from all the Christmas dinners, I was looking forward to this family-esque run restaurant, given the photo of the crown princess of Thailand along with the the resto owners/staff/family gracing you as you enter the establishment, one tells thyself that ahh yes this place will be authentic and good.

Service was pleasant, the elder gentlemen did have a tough accent but service was good nonetheless.

Food... well if I wanted to eat a Latin dish like mechado then i was in for a treat at this Thai restaurant, unfortunately the palette wanted Thai; the main was spicy and more Spanish than Thai. No offense to hard working Mexican cooks but This Thai resto sure had Latin flavor to their dishes.

Bay Area residents and visitors, avoid this place. It might have been a gem once upon a time; but for foodies this place is a dump. Go elsewhere!

data.title: Unfortunately poor
data.text:
We were seated promptly and our orders were taken aa soon as we put our menus down. Our appetizer- satay- came out quickly and was good. So far so good.

Two of four entrees came out. It took another five minutes for the rest of the meals to arrive.

The catfish was completely overcooked. The eggplant was bland. The prawns in clay pot were about 5 prawns in glass noodles that were mostly stuck in a blob. Some celery and onions completed a non-descript entree. The peanut sauce over chicken is exactly that- a pile of chicken with sauce. The tango mango was a sweet concoction that its patron enjoyed. 
We were pleased by the option for brown rice. The place is clean and conveniently located( if you can find parking).
I would look for something else despite the high rating.

data.title: Great Thai Restaurant!
data.text: We were looking for a Thai Restaurant while staying in Palo Alto. This is a must!!! Wonderful food!!!! Great service! Will be back!!

data.title: Food is great!
data.text: We've never actually eaten in the restaurant, but have done the take out for years now. Although it is not traditional Thai cuisine for most of the dishes, the food is really good and consistent. We have never been disappointed with our order.

data.title: Good food and endearing service
data.text: Very friendly owner who makes you feel at home and recommends their very tasty dishes to you.   Curries are very reliable, and good selection of appetizers, and on occasion Northern Thai dishes that are more unusual.   A very good restaurant.   Closes a little early at 9:30, but then everything in Redwood City does.

data.title: Pumpkin Curry, Roti, Fried Banana - SO GOOD
data.text:
I ordered food for delivery through Bangkok Bay's website (serviced by Order Ahead). The food arrived hot and it was some of the best Thai food I've had. Perfectly spicey at spice level 1, lots of pumpkin and lots of veggies (I am vegetarian). I also had the pineapple fried rice which was great. 
We got the dessert "triple delight" to try a few different things. The fried banana blew me away and the roti was also amazing. Can't wait to order from them again.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: What a wonderful surprise! We've been driving by this restaurant for 18 years and just popped in last night for the first time. Fresh and flavorful...we enjoyed the red curry with chicken, the yellow curry chicken, the angel wings, the drunken noodles with beef and the honey glazed grilled pork. Great staff, welcoming and attentive.

data.title: Delicious and spicy
data.text:
As soon as we entered this restaurant, we knew the reviews on Trip Advisor were correct!  The restaurant was packed with people not only at the tables but people who were waiting for takeout.

I love Drunken Noodles with tofu and yes, they made it for me very spicy. My partner had Tom Yum soup and a minced chicken dish. We were in heaven. If we lived in the area, we'd return again and again!

data.title: Spicy Foods
data.text: The foods are greasy and spicy.  But if you like spicy foods, you'll love this restaurant.  Nice and clean. Interior décor made you feel like you were in Thailand.

data.title: Good Thai food, friendly service
data.text:
This restaurant has small parking lot, but it is located near a public parking lot. All the dishes we ordered were very good, including: Pineapple Fried Rice with crab; 3-Flavored fish; Prawns in clay pot; Pad thai with tofu; Grilled rack of lamb in Penang curry with vegetables.
The staff was friendly and attentive.

data.title: Locals love this longtime success
data.text: In a street full of restaurants, locals favor this light, bright and efficient restaurant with great food. We went there recently at lunch during a break from court, and had a great meal for four, piping hot, delivered fast, at a good price. There are other Thai and Vietnamese restaurants very close by, but this seems to be favored by locals.

data.title: I'm a regular
data.text: Bangkok is my go-to place for excellent Thai food.  Great pumpkin curry!  Nice vegetarian options, friendly staff.  When I hosted my own Thai dinner for friends they helped me out with some ingredients I couldn't get at the Asian market…they grow their own kaffir limes!  Parking can be an issue, but I usually find street parking on Broadway across El Camino in front of the high school.

data.title: Great hole in the wall thai food
data.text: Like everyone else says - looks can be deceiving.  Looks dumpy from the street but inside you wouldn't realize it's right next to El Camino.  Remarkably never seems busy - waitstaff very quick and attentive.  Food is delicious - great variety.  We go back about once a month and I regularly have my work meetings catered by them (also great delivery, prompt and just as good as in the restaurant)

data.title: Favorite Thai in Redwood City
data.text: We are new to the area and this restaurant was recommended by one of our new neighbors.  But I could also see that there were many fans of this restaurant by looking at Trip Advisor and Yelp.  I have been twice, once for lunch and once for dinner, and I definitely agree with high ratings I've seen on line.  Food quality and service were both great.  It is my new "go-to" Thai restaurant!

data.title: Spoils You For Almost All Other Thai Food
data.text:
We have been going to Bangkok Bay at least once a month for more than a decade.  My only complaint about this restaurant is that it pretty much ruins you as far as going to any other Thai restaurants -- the food is that special.  Its relatively poorly-marked location is at the corner of Broadway & El Camino in Redwood City.  While the outside appearance of the restaurant looks strip-mall normal, the interior is very nice.  The five Thai sisters that opened the restaurant 17 years ago (and still own it) are all very charming and thoroughly knowledgeable about the menu -- service is a family affair and consistently excellent.  The menu is fairly extensive, and the cook will adjust the spiciness level to your taste.  We have not had a dish there that we did not enjoy.

The restaurant's wine list is a relatively short and undistinguished one, so we regularly bring our own wine for which there is only a modest corkage ($7).  I would recommend this restaurant without reservation to casual diners and foodies alike.
